question: Hello there ~  I am a healthy 38 year old male who underwent a cystoscopy three weeks ago under a urologists care.  I do not have high blood pressure or diabetes.   While I think the procedure was effective at removing a urethral stricture, I am having trouble maintaining a complete erection.   The two side chambers fill with blood during erection, but the chamber on the dorsal (underside) of my penis does not.   My erection is not as firm as it was before the procedure.1) was there a complication during the cystoscopy...and what was it?2) how can this problem be corrected?Thanks,MattCleveland, OH
title: cystoscopy complication a cause for ED?
